votebox.middle.datacollection

Class DataLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • votebox.middle.datacollection.DataLogger

  • public class DataLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    A data logger is a simple wrapper around an s-expression output writer. It offers a few added benefits:
    1) Every expression that gets written to disk needs to be in the form (UID Type Event Timestamp) and this class will guarantee that only entries of this type are written down in the log.
    2) In order to accomplish #1, this class offers a nice interface (a method definition) which eliminates the need for an outside user to even ever construct an ASExpression.

    This module is to be used with human factors testing only. This is not to be confused with the module that does redundant event logging over a network.

      • init

        public static void init(java.io.File filename)
        Init/Change the filename that this DataLogger is logging to. This method must be called before dump(...)
        Parameters:
        filename - This is the filename that this data logger is to log to.

      • dump

        private void dump(ASExpression log)
        Call this method to actually dump an s-expression to the log file. If there is an error, the given s-expression will be saved for later retrieval from getUnloggedMessages().
        Parameters:
        log - This is the log entry that actually needs to be dumped to the log file. This log file must match the template (String String String String)

      • createAndDump

        private void createAndDump(java.lang.String UID,
                 java.lang.String type,
                 java.lang.String event,
                 java.util.Date timestamp)
        Call this method to create a log file entry (an s-expression) and log it to disk. This method creates an s-expression that looks like (UID, type, event, timestamp) with the members of this list given by the parameters of this method.
        Parameters:
        UID - This should be the UID of the control that is generating this event.
        type - This is the type of control (IE ToggleButton or Button)
        event - This is the type of even that is being logged (selected or deselected)
        timestamp - This is a timestamp of when the event occurred locally.
